Class Compiler

java.lang.Object
Compiler
public class Compiler
extends java.lang.Object
Compiles mnemonic-based code into machine code

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> lineBuffer
    Stores list of all lines of code
    private Memory memory
    Store a reference to computer memory
    private OpcodeTable opcodeTable
    Reference to the 2-way opcode lookup table

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Compiler​(Memory memory)
    Constructor initialises lineBuffer, assigns accessible memory and gets an instance of the opcode lookup table

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void compile​(java.lang.String fileName)
    Compiles a given file and stores instructions in memory ready for processor execution
    private void readLinesToBuffer​(java.lang.String fileName)
    Reads a file and puts each line into the lineBuffer
    private void translateLines()
    Translates each line of 'assembly' into machine code and stores each instruction contiguously in memory

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Compiler

      public Compiler​(Memory memory)
      Constructor initialises lineBuffer, assigns accessible memory and gets an instance of the opcode lookup table

  • Method Details

    • compile

      public void compile​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Compiles a given file and stores instructions in memory ready for processor execution
      Parameters:
      fileName - The 'assembly' source code file

    • readLinesToBuffer

      private void readLinesToBuffer​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Reads a file and puts each line into the lineBuffer
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file to read

    • translateLines

      private void translateLines()
      Translates each line of 'assembly' into machine code and stores each instruction contiguously in memory
